What we are about

The mission

We're here to inform people about how many millions of acres of forests have been destroyed by man. We hope we can bring everyone together to open their minds to the reality of the ancients. They supply life to our world.

The Disasters

We are past the theory of global death. For every minute you read this, dozens of acres of woodlands are disapearing. As the forest shrinks, the world shrinks. Life drpping dry.

Fires

Sometimes nature causes fires, but other times the worst fires are caused by careless people. There are many ways to reduce fires. Not having gender reveal parties in nature is one way.

The greedy get hungrier

Afire with greed, green-eyed, only pockets lined in gold will be what remains when there is no more breath to breathe. All the children being born at this time will grow up in a world of dystopian lanscapes, forests so scattered that only in dreams might a sunbeam bounce off leaves.

Deforestation

Recycle all your paper products. Buy only sustainable wood products. Reduce meat consumption. Raise awareness. Fight government corruption. Only we can stop the unnecasary deforestation through small things we do. If enough of us do these things, we can stall or possibly stop illegal actions.

Ways to Help

Emmerse yourself in nature. Even getting away a quarter of a mile into a park with lots of trees will bring up the air quality and you will smell the difference. People feel a sense of calm when in a park with lots of trees and are able to breathe better. Not just from pollution, but also from stress. Trees are our gaurdians.

Plant trees

If you live in a city, join your local tree planting community and help create urban forests in disadvantaged communities. Improve the quality of the air we breathe. Reduce the destructive emmissions, and reduce of the “Urban Heat Island” effect. An increased psychological well-being will benefit all who adhere to taking better care of the environment.

Having a clean neighborhood makes people feel good about where they live. Walking down the street and seeing trash in a street gutter that leads to a storm drain is something no one wants to see.

Throw away trash

If you live in a city, and if you see trash in your neighborhood, don't be afraid to clean it up. Make sure to put some heavy duty gloves on before touch any trash. Use a trash bag and a pick-up-stick. You'd be surprised how much of a difference it'll make. Recruit some friends and ask them to help.
